page.title: 16SCHOOLS
page.content: Stokeinteignhead has a primary school (5 to 11) which serves the village and also Combeinteignhead, Netherton, Haccombe and Rocombe. Five years ago numbers were up to 70 children and three teachers but numbers have now dropped to 30 with two teachers. There has been a school in Stokeinteignhead since 1870. The primary school in Combeinteignhead closed in l926. Secondary age children normally go to the comprehensive school in Teignmouth although some, by parental choice go to schools in Newton Abbot or Torquay. The local authority provides free transport for children going to Teignmouth High School but not for children going to other secondary schools. Children can be considered for the Torquay Grammar schools if their parents so wish.
